intro: Cyclophorus macrocarpus, commonly known as the large-fruited cyclophorus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and the leaves are usually opposite and elliptical in shape. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
